data.text:
You know you want to use WordPress but you‚Äôre tired of Googling information on how to set it up yourself and getting results with too much tech-talk for your liking.

This is your in-depth, yet easy to understand how-to on the inner workings of creating your first website with WordPress.

What if I told you the fastest, most effective way to get your website launched isn‚Äôt to scour the internet for design companies that suit your style (which you‚Äôre still discovering) or budget (which is more beer than champagne) but actually getting your website launched yourself in less than an hour?

Intrigued? Good. Because this is the mind-blowing, super simplified WordPress website starter kit you‚Äôve been searching for.

WITH A LIVE WEBSITE:

YOU‚ÄôLL HAVE SOMEWHERE TO SEND PEOPLE FOR MORE INFORMATION

Using social media as a way to connect with potential clients is great ‚Äì but what happens when algorithms change, or you don‚Äôt want to type out the same answers to FAQ people are asking? Having a place where people can check up on all the information about your service or product makes you to look professional and assures people you‚Äôre committed to your business.

YOU‚ÄôLL GET STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS,

AKA THE SHORTCUT TO SETTING UP EVERYTHING YOU NEED FOR A WORDPRESS WEBSITE

No more endless Googling, friend! It‚Äôs time to choose your domain name, hosting company and build this WordPress website full of information for people who want to pick up what you‚Äôre putting down. The best part? By the time you‚Äôre done the kit, you‚Äôll have a fully functional website ‚Äì all you‚Äôll need to do is enter your content and press LAUNCH.

THIS ISN‚ÄôT YOUR AVERAGE STARTER KIT

Be warned: you‚Äôll have a live website on WordPress. It‚Äôs not just a website checklist filled with to-do items you don‚Äôt know how to complete ‚Äì what you‚Äôll get is a straight-up actionable and complete process to set up your website. Think of this starter kit as the fun way to understand things that usually make you run for the hills from someone who gets it and is ready to explain things in normal-speak, not tech-speak.
